intro: Mentha sylvestris var. candicans, commonly known as the white mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers in whorls along the stem, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. This variety is valued for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in culinary or medicinal applications.
